modalHeading.localStorageHasBeenPrunedCo: The param file settings have been pruned from your browser cache.
modalHeading.useExistingSettingsPrompt: There are existing param file settings. Do you want to use them as a baseline for this session?
browserPrompt.reloadWarning: Die Anwendung wird geschlossen. Wollen Sie fortfahren?
leftNavigation.progressStep.inputFileSel: This virtual machine currently doesn't have a Host OS. Let's begin by adding your ISO file.
Taken from the ISO file you have uploaded.
leftNavigation.progressStep.hint.label: Display hint
leftNavigation.progressStep.hint.seconda: Infos needed to complete subsequent steps,
leftNavigation.progressStep.networkDevic: If you are comming from DPM, the information will be autogenerated from there.
leftNavigation.progressStep.networkAddre: Once the installation is complete, you're set to start managing.
panel.information.requirementsExplanatio: The requirements shown are minimum requirements as indicated in the documentation.
panel.hint.explanation: You will need the following information to complete this dialog. The listed information is typically provided by hardware or network administrators of the system to be installed.
panel.hint.listItem2: OSA device number, layer 2 setting and port number, or
panel.networkDevice.deviceTypeHelp: OSA (Open Systems Adapter) or RoCE (PCI RDMA over Converged Ethernet)
panel.networkDevice.vlanIdHelp: Enter a VLAN ID between 1 and 4094, or leave empty for no VLAN ID.
panel.networkDevice.readChannelHelp: Device bus-ID of the OSA read channel in the format x.y.zzzz.
panel.networkDevice.writeChannelHelp: Device bus-ID of the OSA write channel in the format x.y.zzzz.
panel.networkDevice.dataChannelHelp: Device bus-ID of the OSA data channel in the format x.y.zzzz.
panel.networkDevice.layerTwoToggleHelp: Select 1 for Layer 2 (ethernet) mode, or 0 for Layer 3 (IP) mode
panel.networkDevice.portNumberToggleHelp: Network port to use (0 or 1) in case of networking cards with multiple ports.
panel.networkDevice.fidHelp: Function ID (FID) of the PCI network device in hexadecimal format.
panel.networkDevice.uidHelp: User-defined identifier (UID) of the PCI network device in hexadecimal format.
panel.downloadParamFile.incompletOrInval: The data provided is incomplete or invalid. The param file generated may be unusable.
panel.downloadParamFile.modifiedDataNoti: The data provided has been modified. The param file generated may be unusable.
panel.nextSteps.explanation2: Once the installer is started, use a VNC client to connect to the system at the following address:
panel.nextSteps.explanation3: Once the installer is started, use an SSH client to connect to the system at the following address:
panel.nextSteps.listItem1: Prepare an FTP server with the installer boot files from the RHEL installer ISO:
panel.nextSteps.listItem4: Replace the file named <1>genericdvd.prm</1> with the parmfile contents downloaded from this application.
panel.nextSteps.listItem5: Log on to the IBM Z Hardware Management Console (HMC) that manages the LPAR.
panel.nextSteps.listItem6: Go to <1>Systems Management</1> view for the mainframe containing the LPAR.
panel.nextSteps.listItem8: Select the task <1>Recovery -> Load from Removable Media or Server</1>.
panel.nextSteps.listItem9: Enter the parameters for the FTP server.
